thread.title: HTC One M9 Plus Supreme Camera: the 5.2-inch metal flagship with extreme camera
thread.title_full: HTC One M9 Plus Supreme Camera: the 5.2-inch metal flagship with extreme camera

author: webmaster@whatech.com.au (Eza Ezamie)
title: HTC One M9 Plus Supreme Camera: the 5.2-inch metal flagship with extreme camera
text:
News from: Eza Ezamie Page views: 202 times HTC One M9 Plus made its debut back in March 2015 and it seems like a long time ago. Come 6th October, they are set to release One M9 Plus Supreme Camera that further enhances the already supreme flagship to a higher level. Will the steep price tag scare people off? 
- Advertisement - 
It has been a while since we last heard of the Taiwanese company, and suddenly there was an announcement that One M9 Plus Supreme Camera and Butterfly 3 will hit the market very soon. It must have been kept under wraps for quite some time. But how will it fare against other flagships already in the market such as Galaxy Note 5, Sony Xperia Z5 and the rest of the gang? Life sure is tough at the top… 
With a body of 151 x 72 x 9.6 mm (5.94 x 2.83 x 0.38 in) and weighs 168 g (5.93 oz), it sure isn’t thin nor lightweight – more like your average smartphone. It has a premium all-metal body that features polished edges that are ergonomically tapered to effortlessly fit your grip. Its unibody back is curved to achieve the streamlined look and feel of the iconic HTC One series smartphones. 
The One M9 Plus Supreme Camera will be sporting a 5.2-inch Quad HD Super LCD3 capacitive touchscreen that displays 1440 x 2560 pixels or ~565 ppi pixel density that makes for an excellent viewing. Feast your eyes on great-looking images and videos on the device. What’s more, there is also the fingerprint scanner for additional security. 
Under the hood of the One M9 Plus Supreme Camera is some serious hardware running around. Mediatek MT6795T Helio X10 chipset paired with an Octa-core 2.2 GHz processor, PowerVR G6200 and 3GB RAM screams of a beast hiding inside its metal body. It will feel like a walk in the park to run all the latest apps and games that are out there. - Advertisement - 
Camera-wise, the One M9 Plus Supreme Camera will be sporting a 21 Megapixel primary camera with 5248 x 3936, optical image stabilization, laser autofocus, dual-LED (dual tone) flash, automatic simultaneous video and image recording, geo-tagging, face/smile detection, HDR and panorama. That’s a long list of features that makes for a high resolution and supreme camera. Plus there’s also a 4 Megapixel secondary camera with 1/3'' sensor size, 2µm pixel size, 1080p@30fps and HDR. You don’t normally get a selfie camera loaded with all these. It comes with Duo Camera with uFocus and HTC Eye™ Experience software that provides a very unique effects and easy editing tools. UltraPixel front camera provides up to 300% more light capture than standard pixels, for great selfies in a wide variety of lighting. Plus, you can combine your photos and videos with your friends for footage from multiple points of view with the built-in Zoe app. 
With everything being captured in high detail, the next thing you have to be worried about is whether it has the necessary storage to support it. Thankfully you would not face any issues as the One M9 Plus Supreme Camera has 32GB of internal storage plus an expansion slot that you can add in an additional 128GB microSD card. 
In terms of battery, it comes with a non-removable Li-Po 2840 mAh battery that is just nice for a day full of activities. 
When it comes to software, it will be having the Sense UI 7.0 that is based on Android Lollipop 5.0.2. Not sure whether it will get the update to the latest Marshmallow 6.0 OS since it was just launched. 
Another thing worth mentioning is that the One M9 Plus Supreme Camera can recreate the 5.1 surround sound effect to deliver a cinematic experience. It has a dialogue leveller that keeps a constant volume so that you won’t have to adjust manually. A dynamic equaliser optimises the tone for any content, so you will be able to hear an incredibly rich audio space from both speakers as well as headphones. - Advertisement - 
Things aren’t exactly looking well for HTC and with the introduction of the One M9 Plus Supreme Camera, it sure will boost their profile by a lot. Great screen coupled with amazing hardware and camera, makes for a potent recipe. And everything is wrapped around a beautiful metal body, just like you would expect HTC to have it. Then it will all boil down to pricing at the end, so if you can afford it – it surely won’t disappoint you. 
The HTC One M9 Plus Supreme Camera is expected to be available on October 6 th for an estimated $629 USD price tag. It will come in Gunmetal Gray, Silver Gold and Amber Gold. News From
